website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty winter boots with waterproof seam-sealed bottom.
pros: Multiple layers of insulation in durable high-cut boot
Best option for walking through thick snow while keeping feet nice and dry
cons: Laces can be a challenge to get right

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.text: These are great winter boots. It's been below zero in CO and has snowed a lot. I wear these to the Doggie Park and also wore them to a Broncos game. They are a bit heavy; however, they do what they are meant to do. Keep my feet warm and not let me slip and fall in snow and ice. I love Sorel boots. I had a different pair before these that lasted me for about 3-4 seasons before they were just too worn. I got a pair of Columbia's on sale thinking that with that name they would work good... NOPE! I will now only ever get Sorel from here on out!
customer_reviews.author: Mel1975

customer_reviews.title: Our second set.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second set (my wife and I wear the same size). The first lasted a long time and we were so happy with them we had to try another set. They are a nice weight and easy to walk in for long distances and waterproof up to about 2" (or so). Once above the rubber the insulated sides will get wet. They are perfectly snug and warm. It was amazing to feel the difference of how the new boots felt (after so many years in the old set). We are vegan so it was wonderful to see that they were still available. We have no hesitation in recommending them.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk H.

customer_reviews.title: They live up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. I did a lot of research before buying, because the last time I invested in good winter boots, they didn't end up as well as I had hoped. These came highly rated, and I am happy to say they lived up to all of the hype. I almost can't wait for winter weather to roll around again so that I can wear them again! They are in such great shape after one winter, they still look brand new, even though I used to walk miles in them. They don't rub painfully like some other boots do, and they have great tread for snow and ice. I'm very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Mc

customer_reviews.title: Cute and cozy!
customer_reviews.text: So warm and nice! I live in the south where we can get away with just wearing galoshes on our rare snow days, but this last time I borrowed my husband’s sorrels and my toes stayed so warm I decided to get a pair. These were in sale for a great price! I like the kind with the fur better but these are cute and I like winter white. They were super comfy when I tried them on. Can’t wait till we get another snow to use them, but I’ll use them on rainy days until them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Odom

customer_reviews.title: Glaciers, beaches, and mountains.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip to Iceland. Wore these every day. I knew I'd be wearing extra thick socks so I ordered a women's 10.5 rather than my usual 10. It was a good decision. These were comfortable, warm, and sturdy. Made it the entire trip without falling on my face, so it's a win for me! Also, thought these were cute enough paired with leggings and a sweater to wear out to the bars at night while there.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: A stylish & smart boot
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome. They are warm and stylish. Everywhere I go I get complemented on them and asked where they could be purchased. I would recommend buying a half size or more larger if you are going to work in or wear these boots long term because they are an exact fit and start to feel tight after an extended amount of time. Otherwise a great purchase and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Katina

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold weather👍
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic, well-made shoes!! I deducted a star bc they run smaller than anticipated. I have wide feet. If I lived up North, these would not work on a regular basis bc they squeeze the sides of my feet. Perhaps going up a size would help. They also look best with tights. Jeans looked too bulky, felt like I had sausage legs. Overall, these are meant for very cold weather, Northern cold. I'm about to head up there so I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: catherine

customer_reviews.title: Comfy & Warm Feet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots for an upcoming trip to Alaska so I have not had the opportunity to see how warm they will keep my feet. I usually wear an 8.5 and purchased size 9 to allow space for thick wool socks. The boots fit a little loose with regular socks, so I believe will work perfectly with the thick ones I plan to wear. The boots seem comfortable and are fairly light weight. 4 stars for now, I will have to update my review after my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these plus another pair of Columbias based on reviews and planned to keep one or the other. I'm keeping both. The others are really lightweight and will be great for running around on snowy/slushy days. These will be my actual shoveling and playing in the snow boots. I got these to replace a pair of LL Beans that I've had for 20 years, but were really bulky and have always driven me a little crazy. These aren't lightweight per se, but they don't have nearly the bulk of my prior LL Beans. Very happy with the fit and quality.
customer_reviews.author: AES72

customer_reviews.title: Amazon customer
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Sorel customer for 30 years and have never been disappointed . This product does exactly what says. Being on a farm I need warmth,dry and good traction. This product gets the job done. Sizes are accurate, my 8 is an 8 . Very pleased as always, Thank you Sorel for keeping a great product great, and thank you Amazon for having this product. I would highly recommend this product ☺☺
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm toes!
customer_reviews.text: Finally. Warm toes. I've tried all sorts of shoes that promised warm toes, even came with promised temperature ratings but that failed to keep my toes warm. I mean that, I have a box full of failed winter boots. Actually, did I say these keep my toes warm? The truth is, my feet are sometimes *hot* in these shoes. Warm toes? Check. Dry toes? Check. These boots do what they promised and look pretty decent too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. This is the first review I have ever written on Amazon and I have purchased so much. These warranted a great review. Yes, they were a bit snug, but that's my fault not the product. I should have ordered one size bigger. I normally wear an 8 1/2 in all shoes so naturally i thought an 8 1/2 would be best with a boot. I didn't take into account winter socks. It's really no big deal. They are so warm and comfortable. They are great and in no way warrant a return. It hasn't snowed yet in New England, but I'm sure these boots will keep me warm. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Winter Boot
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how comfortable these boots were right away; I didn't need to break them in at all. The interior linings are VERY warm and the construction is perfect for keeping feet dry and cozy. The wool lining on the top seemed mostly for show, but they keep the top of the boot from chafing the ankles. This is a very high quality boot and worth the price, and Amazon's price was less than what we could get either at the local retailer or even Sorel's own online store.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bellis

customer_reviews.title: Order a half-size larger than your usual size
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable boots. I took the advice of preview reviewers and went up a half-size. (I usually wear 6.5, but ordered a 7 in this boot). The half size larger (7) is the perfect fit. I love that they're waterproof, too.
customer_reviews.author: Accidentally Awesome

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fit is wide
customer_reviews.text: I found these boots to fit wide, which seems to contrast with most reviews here. I usually wear a 7.5 (average width), occasionally an 8, so I went with an 8 based on other reviewers' recommendations. The 8 was huge and I could pull the boot off even after tightening the laces as much as they could go. I exchanged for a 7.5, and it fits much better although still a touch wide. However, it feels well padded with a lot of support so I am keeping them and I think they will work well for my needs (low-impact use).
customer_reviews.author: KatieCrocker

customer_reviews.title: Grandma in Lisbon Me
customer_reviews.text: These were delivered yesterday!! Today it is snowing in Maine, and I have already gone out to shovel my deck, stairs and clean the snow off my car!!! I was being very careful not to slip, but, found these boots worked very well for me. I also work part time at Bowdoin College in Brunswick, Me and was delighted that the boots have a polar bear on them, the trademark for Sorel and also the Bowdoin Mascot. Go Figure!!!!! Not looking forward to more snowstorms, but, I am looking forward to wearing my Sorel Cumberland Boots...
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 8.5 so I ordered one 8.5 and one 9 since I might wear thick socks with these. 8.5 fit me perfectly. They are very warm and so comfortable to walk in. Actually ordered a few other brands, including timberland and I sent them all back and chose this one. Waterproof tested, comfort tested, quality tested and I can tell it will also be slide proof on ice based on the bottom...
customer_reviews.author: egosh

customer_reviews.title: Yeah? I love these!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality boot form a great brand. These were significantly less $ than other styles or colors than Sorel boots. But they work just as hard as the 'pretty' ones. I actually do get complements on these and I suspect I will be wearing these for a very long time. Ice, snow, and muddy fields can't get these boots down. They clean up well so don't be put off by the white!
customer_reviews.author: mothership

customer_reviews.title: Allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: My first review I liked these boots I was wearing on my horse farm . I started having trouble with my feet and an ankle . I figured out I was having allergic reactions to the chemicals in theses boots . 78 dollars down the drain . I see they went up in price . I worn steel toed boots for 33 years in a chemical plant never had trouble with boots . The glue or chemicals in the rubber of theses boots must be nasty . Weeks of pain in my feet .
customer_reviews.author: Rene H.

customer_reviews.title: ... these now 2 or three times and I actually like them less each time
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these now 2 or three times and I actually like them less each time. Wish they had at least half speed laces because the become loose as you walk. They are great for deep snow but there is nothing on the bottom to help grip on ice. I have come close to falling on slick sidewalks and streets a couple times. I've learned to stay in the snow. I will use them because I don't have a car right now and rely on the bus and winters in the Midwest can be brutal. But overall I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Warm, Waterproof, Comfortable, Under $100
customer_reviews.text: My search for a warm, waterproof winter boot for under $100 (~$82) ended with this Sorel. These are not walking shoes, but I walked to break them in, and kept walking for about a mile they were so comfortable (for snow boots). The Thinsulate should keep feet warm enough for shoveling and kicking around in cold New England winters, but I won't be testing them on snow mobiles, arctic hikes, etc. And if you're looking for plush leather in an upper boot, you'll be disappointed-- it's a comfortably-padded material. Best of all, they fit perfectly and that's the hardest thing to find, isn't it? My feet are happy in Merrells as well, if that helps...
customer_reviews.author: my2c

customer_reviews.title: They're doing a fantastic job keeping my feet cozy and dry in the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of winter boots as I am a California transplant. They're doing a fantastic job keeping my feet cozy and dry in the Boston winter so far. They're also extremely comfortable. I have no problem commuting to work with these. However I thought they're supposed to give me more traction. It's still tricky walking on ice with these. Then again, I don't have experience to compare it to walking with any other pair. For $40 I think it's worth it. In terms of full price, I'm not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Vi Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, but half size bigger
customer_reviews.text: I loved the boot itself but it runs a little small. I normally wear a size 8.5 shoe. I will be buying another pair in a size 9.0. I would recommend going up a half size when purchasing especially because people tend to wear a thicker sock as well with snow boots. They are a great boot, super cute and made extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L. Cale

customer_reviews.title: just... wow.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I have never had Sorel anything before, but that won't happen ever again. These boots fit like a glove, almost like they were made to fit my feet! I usually avoid buying any foot ware online, it is hard to make sure you're buying the right size without trying them on first. These boots are incredibly warm, and far more attractive in person than from the picture. Shoveling the snow will never be the same again! I highly recommend these boots for anyone in a cold climate!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Rose Alchin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cold and snow
customer_reviews.text: I've had these in my wish list since last winter. Now that we had our first bit of snow undecided to get them. They are a bit heavy but the traction seems great and they'll be perfect for the cold and snow of Minnesota.
customer_reviews.author: NJCathi

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely YES!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Michigan and these are perfect. They are rated for -25 degrees. Warm them up before going outside. It takes about 30 minutes for the thinsulate lining to warm up while wearing them. Until that happens your feet are a little cold. The uppers are not waterproof so a bit of beeswax will save your feet in deep snow. I have wide feet and typically wear an 8. I purchased an 8 and there is enough room for thick winter socks if needed but I have yet to need them. They are worth every penny. I have suggested them to all my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene P

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear as I walk everywhere. To me they fit as expected. I wear a 7.5 and order 8 for thick sock. They are cute. I haven't worn them long distance yet just out walking dogs. I kinda wish I had gotten black. We don't get many snows usually one a year but the temperature gets cold. I have smartwool socks to wear. I will test them on shorter walks to grocery store or Dr. I am pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: True to Size, looks durable and feet stayed warm in 25 deg F snowy day
customer_reviews.text: I really love these boots I decided to get the brown color too! Now I have two pairs! Bring it on NY winters!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Item received as described and expected. I really like Sorel boots, but due to the price, I wasn't sure if I wanted to buy them. Then I saw these on sale in my size! I'm so glad I ordered them. I normally wear a size 6 shoe/boot. I ordered a 6 and they fit perfectly (using a standard white athletic sock). I'm sure if I switch to a thick woolen, sock that the boot will be a bit more snug. But I do not expect that they will become too tight to wear. Well made and nice looking. Very satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The boots do what they are supposed to to--protect your feet from cold and snow. I am giving it only 3 stars because the quality is so-so, i.e., not what I expected from such a famous brand. Without the name "sorel", these boots would sell for $20 at your local giant superstore. For those interested in a light boot, this is not it. It took a while to get used to the heaviness. I kept them because we are in the middle of a snowstorm and I don't have time to go get something else.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lazic

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE.... LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, the boots are incredible warm and comfortable.... and looks fantastic too... and I payed $23. Thanks Sorel and thanks Amazon for the outstanding work. I must confess, I'm an addicted to Amazon Prime..... I love you guys!
customer_reviews.author: Cristiana

customer_reviews.title: I don’t  recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought theses boots because were good reviews. I live in WNY and the last winter was very strong, and it was impossible for me to wear boots without complaining about having my feet cold, so I tried to used two pairs of cozy socks and my feet are still frozen.
customer_reviews.author: Maribel

customer_reviews.title: Runs small and narrow
customer_reviews.text: These look nice but they run small and are too narrow. Also they are very floppy so they won't provide any ankle support. Probably ok for walking on a sidewalk but definitely not a hiking or outdoor work boot.
customer_reviews.author: sw

customer_reviews.title: Great, warm winter boot
customer_reviews.text: These boots are surprisingly comfortable. They're like walking on rubber clouds. Loved the extra height they gave me. I wore them all day in NYC and my feet did not hurt. The only part that was mildly uncomfortable was the top of the back of the boot- it sort of dug into my lower calf. But that problem was mostly solved when I wore less layers on my legs. These are great shoes and very warm. They are not skid-proof though, so don't buy them expecting to walk on ice. Thread carefully.
customer_reviews.author: oakiemom

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, practical, & good value
customer_reviews.text: I have small feet and wear size 4-4.5 for most brands in U.S. sizing, so these are a bit large but with thick socks and laces they will do. I personally like the extra room in the box area and the easy way of slip in and out. Walked about 1.5 miles in them on paved roads yesterday in 20F and feet were kept warm and not sweaty. The "Turtle Dove/Silver Lining" resembles an off-white color, which is also to my liking. They are relatively lightweight given the bulky look. These should be practical particularly for places like my neighborhood where pathways are covered with heavily salted, dirty & slushy snow all winter long.
customer_reviews.author: MoMoKo

customer_reviews.title: Warm but prevents leaking
customer_reviews.text: Often we can find warm boots or waterproof boots, but mother nature and outdoor activities sometimes require us to have both at once. The rubbery bottoms and the warm lining (which goes right over the top, thus preventing irritation) are a great combination, and not too ugly as designed here. The tightening occurs in the front which is pretty easy, and the heel is supportive. I think they run a bit small, but maybe the snuggly lining will pack down over time. I trust Sorel for real winter wear.
customer_reviews.author: Northern SW

customer_reviews.title: This is a serious great boot!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my pair for 8 years through very cold & deep snowy winters. They hold up beautifully & truly keep your feet toasty warm in frigid temps. Just finished a 7 mile hike in snow with these & they were comfy the whole way. Also bought a pair for my daughter this winter. She loves them!
customer_reviews.author: chriscw

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The temperature where I live often dips to -10 degrees F and these always keep me warm! Great traction on snow and ice too! I usually wear a size 8.5, but I have slightly wide feet so I ordered up to a 9 and they fit very well, though they're a little snug with thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality boots - great for walking in snowstorms, as well as hiking on a trail. They're kind of bulky and don't allow much movement in your ankles, so I don't suggest these for a real hike. They're very warm and have great traction.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Too Small for Tiny Feet, size up
customer_reviews.text: I never need to size up when others review that they had to, I have been told more than once by shoe sale people that I have super narrow feet even though they are long, so despite reviews I decided to try my normal size. The length was perfect, but my toes where so squished together from side to side and by the top and the bottom of the boot that my feet were starting to fall asleep. I am switching them for 1 size bigger. I will update my review when I get the bigger size and wear them out in the snow. Update: Received one full size bigger today and they are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Hunting Family

customer_reviews.title: Received Used Pair Amazon Chinese Products or Seconds Now
customer_reviews.text: Hi Folks. Received a beat up box and a used pair of Sorels when purchasing as advertised "NEW" pair. Amazon has gone to the dogs. More than half of the buys are cheap Chinese products or used seconds claiming to be new products. Just look how search engines have changed in 2020. Once I get new streaming prgrams goodbye Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paid for a new pair, received a USED pair
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a new pair of these, and what was shipped to me was clearly USED. There was a spot of green chewing gum on the bottom of one boot, and the tread had visible wear. As for the product itself, it's waterproof and warm. I walked through a blizzard in two feet of snow wearing them and they worked perfectly fine. They feel big though, and they have too much room in the ankle. It also feels impossible to lace them tight enough, and after a few hours there's a space in the calf. I'm glad I have them, but I wouldn't recommend them to someone else because of the fit and lack of arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots have kept my feet warm and dry with all the snow we've had this year. They are a tad big, but I bought a 9-1/2, when I usually wear a 9, based on the reviews that they run small. I wish I'd gotten a 9 because I don't like thick socks, but I love the boots all the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Warm boots!
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy & warm boot. A little heavier and Han I would like— I kind of clunk along at work in a warehouse! The problem is mostly the color— not brown, but a forest green. Doesn’t sound or look like the “dark tundra” in the pic. I wouldn’t have chosen it, but not reason enough to return.
customer_reviews.author: JAN

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’m a mail lady and I literally walk my entire route. When I tell you these boots are not only stylish but comfortable and warm. I have zero arch. My feet are like flinstones (flat) lol and I can walk all day in them. Great purchase especially for Chicago’s winter.
customer_reviews.author: CandyGyrl

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for an upcoming trip to Colorado and winters in Nebraska. The color is more of an off white or cream than white but still look good. I wear a 7.5 or 8 and per the sizing chart I went with the 8. The boots fit well with or without a heavy sock. I have not worn these outside yet so I cannot speak to how warm they will be. They seem comfortable when walking in the house! Overall, I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these boots
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these boots! They keep my feet toasty warm in the Denver temperatures, where wind is a serious weather event often in the winter. The tread is extra rugged and grippy for those icy/slick spots. I was surprised when I opened the box to discover that the Tundra color is more of a darker olive green than the brown it looks to be in the picture. Either way, still a solid winter boot for anyone looking for a warm, rugged, functional boot.
customer_reviews.author: Kate M.

customer_reviews.title: Great warm boots.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to go to Mammoth. Great fit. I did order half size up as recommended by other reviews and they are fine, maybe should have ordered a full size larger because with thick socks I can see them being a little tight. Not a big deal though. Kept me warm and cozy. Removed a start because they are bulky looking which I'm sure is normal for snow but I'm not used to it.
customer_reviews.author: RPaw

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my wife to go skiing and snow mobiling. (She hates cold;-). She wore them in -20 weather and her feet never got cold. She's happy and I am happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Big

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Boots are NOT waterproof. Water seeped in while I was hiking and had to cross through a small creek of water. Not comfortable wearing for long periods of time. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Diana D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Run a little small
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. Just be aware that they run a bit small. They were especially tight across my toes. They were long enough but I knew there was no way to wear heavy socks with these boots. I wear a true size 9. It's very rare that I wear anything larger. They seem very warm and are well made. They have good arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: comfy. order true to size. i went a ...
customer_reviews.text: comfy. order true to size. i went a half size up from what i usually wear thinking i would need extra room for thick socks but i didnt need any extra room at all. they are too big but i already wore them so now im stuck with too big snow boots for a few seasons....oh well. also after an hour or so in the deep snow my feet did feel cold.
customer_reviews.author: your mom

customer_reviews.title: Warm & comfy but not the right size for me
customer_reviews.text: I loved how these boots looked online & needed to get a pair for the snowy winter I found myself in. I'm a size 9.5 and read the reviews about ordering a size up so when I saw that the only sizes left available were an 8 or a 10 when I was purchasing, felt confident the 10 would do the trick, even if I needed to wear thick socks. The boots arrived and were gorgeous, but sadly the 10 was just too big, even with thick socks on. They were really comfortable, warm & light, but my foot moved around too much inside the boot so I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are amazing and exactly what I needed for the snow in this region. It keeps your feet warm and is easy to wear. Great for walking in snow. Fair warning they are not good for ice, they are slippery when you walk indoors if there is water on the floor. But for ice there is no traction, my solution was to put the yak trax on the boots, they are rubber and studded that can be worn with the boots and they are perfect together.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits snugly but not uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a half size larger than I wear normally. Even with two pairs of thick wool socks, the boots still fit well. They were snug but not even close to being uncomfortable. They did not pinch and they kept my feet very warm. I have very odd-shaped feet and wear only wide width shoes, and these boots fit me just fine. I would recommended purchasing a half size larger than normal though just to accommodate the extra layers of socks you'll probably be wearing with these snow boots.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Semi-prefect winter boots
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty decent; keeps my feet nice and warm. Just wish it would have better gripping support on the soles, tends to get pretty slippery when on ice.
customer_reviews.author: Krisha L.

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Dry
customer_reviews.text: These arrived just in time for a 22" snowfall. Kept my feet warm and dry while shoveling. You don't even need socks they are so warm! I usually wear a Women's 5, and ordered a 5.5 as I heard they run small. The 5.5 was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: KRuss

customer_reviews.title: Luv these boots ,Sorel Cumberland
customer_reviews.text: Feels lovely, Wore them to work & I walk a lot ,glad I ordered a half size larger, great with thick socks, 1st pair of Sorels but not the last✅Excited to trythen in snow!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ms V

customer_reviews.title: ... high arches and it is difficult to find a comfortable waterproof boot to hike in
customer_reviews.text: I have high arches and it is difficult to find a comfortable waterproof boot to hike in. This is the best one I found and does have decent arch support but it is bulkier than I would like. I had a pair of London Fog suede boots that fit perfectly and could be worn as a dress boot or hike in and they were waterproof. Sadly I have not been able replace these.
customer_reviews.author: BETH A CORRIGAN

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and down right Dainty for a Sorel boot!
customer_reviews.text: I've had sorels for 20 years. And this is by far the most comfortable, supportive, WARM boot! It's a full foot hug in a nice snug fit! Lots of contoured padding on the inside with no weird rubber seam hitting the back of the heel! Lace up snug for my pencil thin lower legs, providing wrap around protection and cozy cozy happiness! Sized accurately. Wear an 8. 8 fits perfect :) These will get alot of outside in the snow ranch work wear. I'll let you know how they hold up. Since I usually get the full leather uppers.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Finally...boots that are warm, fit right and will last!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been too cheap to buy myself a pair of good boots and every year I suffer. Well this year, due to an early snowfall and an active 3 year old, I decided to splurge and buy myself some good boots so that my feet are warm and I can play outside with the kiddo! At $71, a little more than I wanted to pay but I know I'll get my monies worth well beyond a few years. The boots fit great, I take a 7.5 and the 8 is perfect, with some room for heavier socks. They are lightweight and not clunky. So glad I splurged!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warmest Boots Ever
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Easy to get on, good traction and very warm. Our winters are cold, sometimes icy and most often windy. I wear these boots twice a day to walk to the barn to feed my horses plus other chores around my ranch. The traction is great on icy ground and the tops are high enough that walking through deep snow is not a problem. Caked mud and muck comes off easily and I can wear them to run into town without concern. They are also narrow enough to fit into a stirrup if the occasion arises. I am ordering a back up pair so when these wear out I have a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K. Shoults

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these boots and I am obsessed with. Fit as expected and it's super warm. I used today with -1 and my feet was warm. If your looking for a nice snow boots, you really should consider to buy these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Lígia Bueno

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased
customer_reviews.text: All in all, I'm very happy. They are just a teeny, weeny bit narrow in the toes, but nothing to get excited about. I do have a corn on one little toe, so I could feel it, but it didn't hurt. Other than that, they are very comfortable and warm, and I enjoyed playing my Newfoundland dog while wearing my new boots in the snow. He was happier that I would stay outside longer than usual, so I have to say this was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wrknnwfTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boots
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our vacation back home to Wisconsin and with negative temperatures these boots saved my feet! Highly suggest!

customer_reviews.title: Great Stylish Winter Boot!
customer_reviews.text: Love these winter boots! Great for walking the dog, shoveling the driveway, or going for a walk. They fit you foot so you can move and stay dry. Not overly big and clunky, more fitted and stylish too! Excellent quality, well made!
customer_reviews.author: DreamerNorth

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality! Kept feet warm!
customer_reviews.text: Recently used these in Tahoe. Trekked in snow while it was 20 degrees and they kept my feet dry and warm! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: BEST BOOTS EVER!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT FIT! True 8. Plenty of toe room without causing a slippy-fit. Warm and cozy. Totally stylish. Waterproof. Lightweight. Wearable all day long for work or play and you'll still wish you could wear them to bed. AWESOME BOOT!!
customer_reviews.author: GRANNYWHIPPLE

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable boot.
customer_reviews.text: I definitely like these boots. Very comfortable. My only problem is that I ordered a full size larger than normal to accommodate thick wool socks to be worn with. Too tight, but works well with thin socks and my feet didn't get cold. However this winter has been very mild and not a true test.
customer_reviews.author: sleepy

customer_reviews.title: Great  value solid boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! I bought a pair at high end sporting goods store 5 years ago and they have been my go to hiking, fall and winter boot (spring too but spring is cold here in Montana) I finally bought a new pair at a great price here on amazon. The old ones mi g the have limped throughost one more year but they were getting pretty worn out. The tread was quite low and I had worn a hole through the lining near the heel. $60 for 5 years is a great deal! They say they are rated to negative 20 degrees but for me, they are a 20 to 50 degree rating.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in June when I knew we were moving to Alaska. I just wore them for the first time the other day and let me just say, awesome!! I have been wearing rain boots for the past month as it hasn't really been cold enogh for my Sorels but my feet were always cold. So I decided to bring out the Sorels, my feet we not cold once when I had these on!! They do run big, I wear a 7-7.5 and these fit more like an 8 but I don't mind as I will have bigger socks on when it's colder. They are comfortable to wear, very warm and look great over all great boot!
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy J

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best boots I've ever owned. I wear them hiking in the snow in Minnesota in 25 below temps and my feet are cozy and comfortable. They are a little big but I am usually and 8.5 or 9 and the 9 is very comfortable. My only issue is this color is not true to my computer screen. I thought they'd be brown but they are like an army green. I kept them since the price was right and it is a neutral.
customer_reviews.author: An's Review

customer_reviews.title: love these. FAVORITE BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at DWS in a sixe 8, they were too small, they told me they did not come in 1/2 sizes, for the heck of it I checked on amazon, low and behold, 1/2 sizes, the are warm, although we only had snow once this year, I am in MI, wore then with a pair of smartwools and roasted my toes! I want to buy them in another color, love these. FAVORITE BOOTS
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow and stiff
customer_reviews.text: This is not the boot for you if you're feet are even a little wide. These were extremely stiff and tight around the foot and ankle even though I ordered up a half-size. If your feet are wider, check out the Sorel Caribou boots. After trying four pairs those were the only ones that were comfortable enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Lee

customer_reviews.title: but they are great boots. Totally awesome
customer_reviews.text: I did return them, but they are great boots. Totally awesome. I just didn't like the brown "tundra" color because it's actually a greenish brown and that wasn't what I was looking for. Which stinks because these boots are awesome. The color choices just kind of stink. The black ones would be great if not for the Santa Clause white fur on top.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THE FIT!
customer_reviews.text: i HAVE BOUGHT THESE BEFORE AND DO JUST ABOUT EVERYTHING IN THEM! i WALK EXTENSIVELY AND FEEL VERY SECURE NEGOTIATING ICY CONDITIONS. i WEAR HEAVY THERMAL SOCKS AS WELL SO FACTOR IN SOME WIGGLE ROOM IN THE TOE BOX...i WEAR THESE WITH SKINNY JEANS OR BOOT CUTS AS WELL AS FOR HOURS OF SHOVELING! A SOLID. ATTRACTIVE BOOT THAT ALLOWS YOU FREEDOM FROM OUR UNPREDICTABLE WINTERS WHEN OTHER BOOTS HAVE FAILED TO DELIVER.....
customer_reviews.author: inspireme

customer_reviews.title: Sorel makes great boots
customer_reviews.text: Sorel makes great boots, love the overall fit of these. My only one complaint is the picture makes these look like more of a white color and when I received them they were very cream (almost dirty) looking. I still gave a 5 star review because that will not show as much with my snow pants over them and does not effect the quality or the fit of the boots.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Good quality boots, size runs small
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice, well made boots. They were a gift for my wife who needed a good pair of warm boots for the long cold winters here. I was surprised that she liked them and even said they look really nice because she generally doesn't like clothes or shoes I buy for her The only issue with the boots is the sizes run small. We had to return the first pair, which we ordered in the her normal shoe size, for a full size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Hardwater Hopper

customer_reviews.title: so I went to a local shoe store and found a pair of Timberlands at about $95 that fit just fine. No more returning products and
customer_reviews.text: Where the top of my foot is -- the opposite of the side of the arch -- hit the top part of the boot between the rubber and the vinyl VERY UNUSUALLY. It is the 4th pair of boots I have had to return between Sorel and LL Bean, so I went to a local shoe store and found a pair of Timberlands at about $95 that fit just fine. No more returning products and snow is right around the corner!
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I'm a dogwalker, and I walk all day in the rain and snow. These boots are super-comfortable and keep my my feet warm and dry all day long. I bought my true size and they fit perfectly. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Trudi M. Rosenblum

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these!!! These are the 1st boots I have owned that are waterproof and warm. I just finished shoveling and my feet weren’t cold and they stayed dry. I love these. If anyone needs. Pair of warm boots for the winter you NEED these!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Tight
customer_reviews.text: These boots look very nice, the upper is more of a canvas, which cooncerns me for how it might stain when encountering mud. Unfortunately, the instep (part where the boot meets the top of my foot) was too tight as there was a seam there where the parts come together. If you have a high instep or live in muddy weather, these may not be the boots for you.
customer_reviews.author: Brigid Farrell

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't believe these fit....
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 4 in shoes and ordered size 5 in this book--the smallest available. They looked big from the outside, but were small enough on the inside to make me not concerned. I have not had occasion to wear them, but see no problem staying warm, safe re tread, and dry. I would prefer a black trim on the top, but will dye/color this white trim somehow. This is a great boot and the price was just right. I highly recommend them......
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: As other people has recommended to get a size up is correct
customer_reviews.text: As other people has recommended to get a size up is correct. I wear a size 8 and got a size 9 they fit perfectly. I would definitely recommend these boots. I am a mail carrier and these boots definitely keep my feet warm for hours with no toe warmer inserts.
customer_reviews.author: takesheia tillery

customer_reviews.title: great boot
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for several years and they are the best warm boots. My daughter got this pair and she is pleased. Just got back from playing disc golf in the snow- no issue! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P. F. Impink

customer_reviews.title: So cute and warm
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Very warm, and the white color is cute and feminine. I ordered 1/2 size up to ensure room for thick socks, and could have ordered a full size.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Good boots - would recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for a trip to the Arctic circle in Norway. The average temperature was about 27 degrees. The boots kept my feet warm most of the time. Only once did my toes start to get cold, which was after 5 hours in the cold. The boots did run a little small, definitely were a snug fit. Would recommend, they are quality boots that hold up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm and stylish
customer_reviews.text: They look great, I love them! They were a little snug so I was worried because I wouldn’t be able to wear a thick pair of socks. I wore regular white socks and I wasn’t cold at all so, I actually liked how snug they were because my feet didn’t slide around at all. Would recommend them based on style and warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are really solid winter boots. I wear them when I take my dogs walking/hiking in the woods and they keep my feet warm and dry every time. They're very comfortable too. I only wish I had ordered my usual size, 8.5, and not sized up to 9. They work with thick socks, but I think the 8.5 would have been better for me. These are a bit too wide for my calves, and I have to tighten the laces as much as possible. They are really great boots, just stick to your normal size.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots.  Runs small!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the boots overall and they need to be broken in, but the size chart is incorrect. I ordered larger than it suggested for my measurement, and it was still a size too small. The next size up was much more expensive, so I did not get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: A superb snow boot in every respect
customer_reviews.text: Easy on & off, incredibly warm and sturdy. I got mine at the tail end of winter, with only one snowfall, so I haven't worn them more than 3 times, but the grip on the soles are great and the boot is extremely comfortable for long wearing. They are also surprisingly light and flexible. Easy to drive in as well. I mistakenly bought a 1/2 size up - I read the other reviews and thought I needed to. Even with very thick socks, they are a bit too large, but I'm keeping them anyway as they are not uncomfortably large.
customer_reviews.author: Austenesque

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.  Very stylish too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a present for my mom (she is 70). She loves them. They keep her feet warm and dry and are very stylish. Thought about going back and ordering myself a pair.
customer_reviews.author: waww

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: They were slightly too small. Had to return them for a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Calidjone

customer_reviews.title: I have very narrow feet, extreme high arches, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have very narrow feet, extreme high arches, and plantar fasciitis (probably from a lifetime of wearing Payless Shoe Source flats). I needed boots for everyday wear as well as be versatile and waterproof to go snowshoeing in. Bing! These are extremely functional, but also cute boots without looking too trendy.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne K

customer_reviews.title: good boot
customer_reviews.text: I use this boot mostly for feeding and watering my goats. Winter has challenges and this boot has over come most of them. Keeps my feet warm. Grips well to snow and ice. They are comfortable and warm. I have used the to sled ride too. I read a review that they ran a little small so I ordered an 8 instead of 71/2. Eights fit me well so go a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Barbi

customer_reviews.title: Cute and mostly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots are lighter and less bulky than most snow boots. They have great treads and the color combination is pretty versatile too. When I first tried them on, they felt so comfortable I was sure I'd keep them. But after a while, I became aware of a piece on the top of the boot where the lacing begins, and the longer I wore them the more the piece bothered me, so I returned them. I've decided to go with the Vasque Pow Pows instead, which are even more comfortable and waterproof to boot (the Cumberlands are merely waterresistant, although the rubber section seems waterproof).
customer_reviews.author: neve

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around winter boot.
customer_reviews.text: After checking out several different boots, I finally settled on this one and I'm glad I did. These are great medium-weight boots that are warm, relatively light, and comfortable. I normally wear a size 7 1/2 shoe, so after reading some of the other reviews, I ordered a size 8. However, the 8 was too big and I ended up sending the 8's back and getting the 7 1/2, which fits perfectly, even with thicker socks. I would recommend these boots to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: sam spade

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Colorado Winters!
customer_reviews.text: I am normally a size 9 in shoes so I decided to get a 9 in these boots because my feet measured to be 10" like the size chart had stated. I was a little nervous about this because of all the mixed reviews about them not being true to size. So when I got them they fit perfectly! Even with a thick sock they fit just fine, although you don't really need a thick sock in these because they keep my feet nice and toasty! They are also great when walking in icy areas and they hardly slide when moving on ice.
customer_reviews.author: NiMu

customer_reviews.title: Sorel Quality Snowboots
customer_reviews.text: These fit great and are very warm. It's been a colder than usual winter season and these are ending up as my go-tos for snow and ice. They seem skid-proof and are definitely waterproof. High quality stitching and materials.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Ayana

customer_reviews.title: Regreted to bought
customer_reviews.text: These boots do not warm our feet! I have one of Columbia it’s mu better! And these boots was sooo expensive! I’m regretting to bought 😭
customer_reviews.author: Isabela Tavares

product_meta.title: Sorel Women's Cumberland Boot
product_meta.description:
The Cumberland boot from Sorel brings you warm, protective comfort during cold weather. The rubber outsole has a multi-patterned tread for enhanced traction, and it extends far upward to keep water and slush out. A durable, rip-stop nylon shaft covers thick interior padding and a soft fabric lining.

Sorel's cold weather footwear is ideal for those participating in active winter sports like snowmobiling or sledding, or for activities where maximum protection is required -- like all-season hunting or fishing, or simply going to work.
feature_bullets: Tall winter boot featuring waterproof bootie, faux-faux fur cuff, and durable rip-stop nylon shaft with angled D-ring laces
Thick interior padding with fabric lining
Color "Dark Tundra" is olive green, but appears brown in image
